alfredsnippet.snippet:
Arthur Koestler, The Watershed: A Biography of Johannes Kepler, p.149

"A locksmith who opens a complicated lock with a crude piece of bent wire is not guided by logic, but by the unconscious residue of countless past experiences with locks, which lend his touch a wisdom that his reason does not possess."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Wisdom that Reason Does Not Possess
